channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Brace Yourself: Laptops Prices Are About to Skyrocket
item.description: Dell says it will take 'targeted pricing action, when necessary.'

item.title: This startup built a Fitbit for your brain to combat chronic stress
item.description: Awear won the Battlefield 200 health stage pitch competition at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025.

item.title: SpaceX reportedly in talks for secondary sale at $800B valuation, which would make it America’s most valuable private company
item.description: The eye-popping figure reflects how routine mega-valuations have become in private markets.

item.title: Meta acquires AI device startup Limitless
item.description: Limitless said it shares Meta's vision of bringing personal superintelligence to everyone.

item.title: This Telescope’s Final Data Release Just Killed 30 Cosmological Theories
item.description: The Atacama Cosmology Telescope in Chile not only confirmed one of the greatest mysteries in the universe—it also ruled out dozens of models that attempted to solve it.

item.title: Chamberlain blocks smart home integrations with its garage door openers — again
item.description: Garage door opener manufacturer The Chamberlain Group has launched a new version of the communication platform that powers its connected garage door openers - and it's bad news for smart home users. The new Security+ 3.0 platform, launching alongside Chamberlain's latest openers, shuts down the workarounds that third-party accessory makers such as Tailwind, Meross, and […]...

item.title: Est-ce que l’algorithme de LinkedIn est sexiste ?
item.description: Des femmes ont tenté l’expérience d’apporter des modifications bien précises à leur compte LinkedIn : elles ont ajouté une moustache à leur photo de profil et elles ont décoché le genre féminin pour choisir le féminin. Résultat : le réseau social les aurait soudainement valorisées. Son algorithme est-il sexiste ?

item.title: Horses, the Most Controversial Game of the Year, Doesn’t Live Up to the Hype
item.description: First it was banned. Then its sales blew up. But Horses fails to meet the lofty goals of its own ideas.

item.title: Frank Gehry, world-renowned architect, dies at 96
item.description: Gehry was awarded every major prize architecture has to offer, including the field’s top honor, the Pritzker Prize. Frank Gehry, who designed some of the most imaginative buildings ever constructed and achieved a level of worldwide acclaim seldom afforded any architect, has died. He was 96.

item.title: Star Wars’ original theatrical cut returns to theaters in 2027
item.description: Disney is bringing a “newly restored version” of the original, 1977 theatrical cut of Star Wars back to theaters on February 19th, 2027. It will only be available in theaters for “a limited time,” Disney says, and it’s being released as part of “Lucasfilm’s yearlong 50th anniversary celebration” for the franchise. Tickets aren’t on sale […]

item.title: Buying Warner Bros. Gives Netflix What It’s Always Needed: An Identity
item.description: The $83 billion deal gives the streamer a century’s worth of prestige television and movies, from Batman movies to Game of Thrones. It also ends the streaming wars.

item.title: Meta’s Chatbot Will Provide AI-Powered Live News via CNN, Fox News
item.description: Meet your new news anchor, Meta AI.

item.title: Urban mining is a smarter path to mineral independence
item.description: The next gold rush for rare earth elements is in our homes and in landfills. In South Korea several weeks ago, the U.S. and China came to a temporary agreement, in which they’ll kick a rare-earth can down the road.

item.title: GLP-1 Drugs Like Ozempic Might Have a Side Effect Nobody Expected
item.description: A new study finds a possible association between GLP-1 drugs like semaglutide and chronic cough, though the authors are calling for more research.

item.title: Feds investigate Waymo robotaxis for reportedly passing school buses in Austin
item.description: Waymo robotaxis are reportedly under investigation for illegally passing school buses in Austin, Texas.

item.title: ChatGPT’s user growth has slowed, report finds
item.description: ChatGPT's global monthly active users only grew by around 5% from August to November, while Gemini's users grew by about 30%.

item.title: ‘Jujutsu Kaisen: Execution’ Is All the Worst Impulses of the Anime Compilation Film Format
item.description: Mappa's theatrical hodgepodge of a compilation film and preview of 'Jujutsu Kaisen' season 3 showcases the inherent flaws of the popular supernatural shonen series more than its merits.

item.title: AI readiness: Philanthropy’s hidden multiplier
item.description: The difference between social impact reaching thousands versus millions often comes down to investing in AI. When film cameras were invented, people didn’t become filmmakers overnight. We pointed cameras at theater stages, digitizing what already existed. It took us a while to reimagine what film cameras could unlock. The real opportunity wasn’t recording theater plays. It was stepping outside and inventing cinema. ...

item.title: Pantone’s ‘Cloud Dancer’ color party is a recession indicator
item.description: Pantone's color of the year for 2026 is white - sorry, Cloud Dancer. Pantone announced the shade on Thursday, and describes it as a "discrete white hue offering a promise of clarity." The accompanying image shows a person with cropped hair in billowy white clothing, arms outstretched over a background of clouds. "PANTONE 11-4201 Cloud […]

item.title: An influential article that called Monsanto’s Roundup safe for humans has been retracted 25 years later
item.description: The paper, which had a major impact on policymaking, appears to have been based on unpublished studies by the controversial agricultural company. In April 2000, Elsevier published an article in the journal Regulatory Toxicology and Pharmacology, which claimed that the herbicide Roundup (glyphosate) from the Monsanto Company didn’t pose a risk of cancer or other health issues for humans....

item.title: Critics Choice Awards nominations 2026: Sinners and One Battle After Another take a commanding lead
item.description: "Sinners" and "One Battle After Another" lead the nominations for the 2026 Critics Choice Awards.

item.title: Garmins best running watches are on sale for the holidays, starting at $149
item.description: Amazon has slashed prices up to $250 on Garmin Forerunner, Venu, and fēnix watches for the holidays! Get a GPS running watch starting at just $149.99.

item.title: Trump Mobile’s refurbished iPhones are an unsurprisingly bad deal
item.description: It's been well established that the Trump Phone doesn't exist. But that isn't the only phone Trump Mobile sells. It also offers a range of refurbished Apple and Samsung handsets that you can buy right now. You really shouldn't though. I was relieved reading Allison's coverage over the last two weeks to discover that not […]

item.title: It’s Official: The Original Theatrical Cut of ‘Star Wars’ Is Coming Back to Theaters
item.description: Lucasfilm is celebrating the film's 50th anniversary on February 17, 2027, in the best possible way.

item.title: Fed’s favorite inflation indicator stayed elevated in September as spending weakened
item.description: The data indicates that core inflation was muted in September and will bolster the case for a cut to the Fed’s key interest rate at its next meeting on December 9 and 10. The Federal Reserve’s preferred measure of inflation changed little in September, likely easing the way to a widely expected interest rate cut by the central bank next week.
